holidays.name: National Radio Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the invention and impact of the radio, honoring the technology that revolutionized communication and entertainment.
holidays.origin: National Radio Day was inspired by the birthdate of inventor Guglielmo Marconi, credited with pioneering radio technology in the late 19th century.
holidays.funFact: The first radio broadcast is often attributed to 1906, and today, radio reaches over 95% of the US population weekly!

holidays.name: World Mosquito Day
holidays.description: Commemorates the discovery that female mosquitoes transmit malaria, raising awareness about mosquito-borne diseases and prevention efforts.
holidays.origin: Observed since 1897, the day marks Dr. Ronald Ross's discovery of the malaria parasite in the stomach of a mosquito in 1897.
holidays.funFact: Mosquitoes are considered the deadliest animals on Earth due to the spread of diseases causing millions of deaths annually.

holidays.name: National Senior Citizens Day (Philippines)
holidays.description: A Filipino observance to honor and appreciate the contributions and hard work of senior citizens in society.
holidays.origin: Established by the Philippine government to promote respect and care for the elderly population.
holidays.funFact: The Philippines celebrates this day with activities encouraging young people to connect with senior citizens and share life stories.

holidays.name: National Lemonade Day
holidays.description: A fun day dedicated to the refreshing and zesty drink beloved especially during hot summer days‚Äîlemonade!
holidays.origin: Started as a fun way to encourage kids to run lemonade stands and learn about entrepreneurship, money management, and community involvement.
holidays.funFact: Lemonade dates back to ancient Egypt around 1000 AD, making it one of the oldest known drinks!
